publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3807 Pauline McNeill: Labour Students, “Sex, Lives and Politics” Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the “Sex, Lives and Politics” campaign run by Scottish Labour Students and the Terrence Higgins Trust; welcomes the £15 million investment to improve equality of access to sexual health care in Scotland; further welcomes the creation of Scotland’s first-ever National Sexual Health Advisory Committee; calls on the Scottish Executive to extend chlamydia postal testing across Scotland, and further calls on the Executive to meet the NHS Quality Improvement Scotland target of achieving clinical standards for waiting times in cases of sexually transmitted infection.

S2M-3807 Labour Students, “Sex, Lives and Politics” Campaign (lodged on 11 January 2006) Mr Jamie Stone*, Sarah Boyack*, Nora Radcliffe*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Marlyn Glen*, Robin Harper*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Bill Butler*, Trish Godman*, Richard Baker*, Jackie Baillie*, Susan Deacon*

S2M-3807 Pauline McNeill: Labour Students, “Sex, Lives and Politics” Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the “Sex, Lives and Politics” campaign run by Scottish Labour Students and the Terrence Higgins Trust; welcomes the £15 million investment to improve equality of access to sexual health care in Scotland; further welcomes the creation of Scotland’s first-ever National Sexual Health Advisory Committee; calls on the Scottish Executive to extend chlamydia postal testing across Scotland, and further calls on the Executive to meet the NHS Quality Improvement Scotland target of achieving clinical standards for waiting times in cases of sexually transmitted infection. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone, Sarah Boyack, Nora Radcliffe, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Dr Elaine Murray, Marlyn Glen, Robin Harper, Mr Frank McAveety, Marilyn Livingstone, Bill Butler, Trish Godman, Richard Baker, Jackie Baillie, Susan Deacon, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-3807 Labour Students, “Sex, Lives and Politics” Campaign (lodged on 11 January 2006) Maureen Macmillan*, Shiona Baird*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-3807 Labour Students, "Sex, Lives and Politics" Campaign (lodged on 11 January 2006) Cathy Peattie*
